org.silex.core.block.BlockBuilder

type
class
This class exposes method used to build/init a block. It is in charge of : - loading the data of a block from an external file - deserialising this data to set the block's data and instantiate/init it's children - load a block's DOMObject - instantiate a block's native class instance - push the block's properties into it's class instance or DOMObject

Static Methods

deserializeBlockData(block : Block, serializedBlockData : String) : Void

parameters
block
serializedBlockData
Fills a block

Constructor

new(block : Block)
class constructor. Store the block that will be built

Instance Methods

createNativeClassInstance() : Void

Instantiate the native class for this block with the block's class name, coming from the BlockData structure,

loadBlockData(successCallback : BlockBuilder -> Void, errorCallback : String -> Void) : Void

parameters
successCallback called when the data is loaded
errorCallback called when there is a loading error
Starts the loading of the block's data with the block's fileUrl attribute, containing the URL of the file to load. store the success and error callback for later use

loadDOMObject(skinUrl : String, successCallback : BlockBuilder -> Void, errorCallback : String -> Void) : Void

parameters
skinUrl the url of the skin to load (might be a .swf, .jpg, .html... depending on the runtime)
successCallback
errorCallback
Starts the loading of the block's DOMObject (skin) with the provided skinUrl containing the URL of the file to load

setBlockAttributes() : Void

Set the BlockData properties either on the controller class or directly on the skin if no controller class was defined for this block
